results.title: The Bicyclist
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Film Junior and Kobenhavns Politi
results.brief_description: A safety education film presented from the point of view of a red bicycle, owned first by a boy who obeyed the traffic rules and then by one who brought himself and the bicycle to a sad fate. The first boy is seen riding sensibly on the road and passing a police cycling test. The bicycle is then stolen by a lad whose reckless riding leads to a serious accident to himself and the bicycle falling into the river to rust. The film brings out a number of specific points about safe and dangerous cycling.

results.title: The Bergen International Festival
results.brief_description: Describes the international cultural festival held in Bergen, Norway each year. The festival, attended by people from all over the world, is dedicated to the memory of Edvard Grieg. Outdoor theatre, philharmonic orchestras, folk dancing displays, ballet, singing and painting are some of the attractions. Concerts are held in historic buildings all over the town. Birgit Nilsson sings and finally the Bergen Harmonia plays Grieg’s Concerto in A Minor.

results.title: The Belgian begonia
results.creator_credit: Genevieve Grandry and Belgian Ministry of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The cultivation of begonia tubers at Ghent for export showing the care with which they are planted and tended. Shows the flowers in colourful profusion in gardens, parks, and homes.

results.title: The Beginning of life (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lars Wallen and Sveriges radio aktiebolag
results.brief_description: Beginning and ending with sequences showing the birth of a child, the film illustrates the growth of the human embryo from the release of the sperm until the ninth month.

results.title: The Beautiful state of mind: Massachusetts
results.brief_description: Massachusetts’ forests, rivers, roads, villages in all four of the year’s seasons. A simulated colonial village, snowmobiling, bobsledding and other sequences covering the Boston symphony, a country furniture auction, canoeing, sporting events and nightlife are all highlighted in this travel documentary.

results.title: The Bear and the hunter
results.brief_description: The story of a bear hunt. Photographed in northern Lapland by Arne Sucksdorff, the film follows Anund the Hunter and his dog on the trail of a bear through forests, over valleys and streams and into the high mountains. When the bear injures the dog, Anund retreats in panic, leaving the bear in possession of the battlefield.

results.title: The Back health program
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Occupational Health, Safety and Workers Compensation Unit and New South Wales. Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Amanda Gore is renowned for her work in occuaptional health. It is true that many workers will suffer from back-related health problems. The purpose of this program is to develop better back health and preventative strategies to minimise the risk of back injury. The videocassette and booklet are divided into five modules: 1. How back pain develops. 2. Sitting. 3. Lifting. 4. Preventing back injury. 5. Exercises. The three posters in the package are: 1. Guidelines for lifting. 2. Your body’s warning signs. 3. Back exercises. By following the simple and effective exercises, the risk of back injury can be reduced.
